Check the validity of the experimental design

t_test_sam.Rd

This manual page describes the computation of statistical test using [QFeatures] objects. In the following functions, if `object` is of class `QFeatures`, and optional assay index or name `i` can be specified to define the assay (by name of index) on which to operate.

The following functions are currently available:

- `compute.t.test(xxxxx)` xxxxx.

- `compute.group.t.test(xxxxx)` xxxxx.

- `limma.complete.test(object, sampleTab)` uses the package Limma

t_test_sam

# S4 method for SummarizedExperiment
t_test_sam(object, sampleTab, FUN, ...)

# S4 method for QFeatures
t_test_sam(object, i, name = "ttestAssay", FUN, ...)

Arguments

object

An object of class `QFeatures`.
sampleTab

xxxxxxx
FUN

xxx
...

Additional parameters passed to inner functions.
i

A numeric vector or a character vector giving the index or the name, respectively, of the assay(s) to be processed.
name

A `character(1)` naming the new assay name. Defaults are `ttestAssay`.

Format

An object of class standardGeneric of length 1.

Details

xxx

Examples

library(QFeatures)
utils::data(Exp1_R25_pept, package='DAPARdata2')
object <- Exp1_R25_pept[1:1000,]
object <- addAssay(object, QFeatures::filterNA(object[[2]],  pNA = 0), name='filtered')
object <- addListAdjacencyMatrices(object, 3)

object <- t_test_sam(object, i=3, name = "ttest", FUN = 'compute.t.test', contrast = 'OnevsAll')
object <- t_test_sam(object, i=3, name = "ttest_group", FUN = 'compute.group.t.test', contrast = 'OnevsAll')
object <- t_test_sam(object, i=3, name = "ttest_Limma", FUN = 'limma.complete.test', comp.type= 'OnevsAll')
object <- t_test_sam(object, i=3, name = "ttest_Anova", FUN = 'wrapperClassic1wayAnova', with_post_hoc=TRUE, post_hoc_test='Dunnett')
